meanings.sent1: The old curmudgeon yelled at the kids to get off his lawn.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor is known as the neighborhood curmudgeon because he never smiles.
meanings.sent3: The curmudgeon's grumpy face scared away the trick-or-treaters on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: His boss was a curmudgeon, always finding fault in everything he did.
meanings.sent5: The curmudgeon's constant scowl made everyone avoid him at the office.

meanings.sent1: The wealthy curmudgeon refused to spend a penny on anyone but himself.
meanings.sent2: My uncle is a curmudgeon when it comes to sharing his snacks.
meanings.sent3: The curmudgeon counted his coins every night, unwilling to part with any.
meanings.sent4: She was a curmudgeon with her time, never willing to help others in need.
meanings.sent5: The old man was a curmudgeon, hoarding his possessions and never giving to charity.
